channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kennedy Center vows to sue musician who canceled performance over Trump name change
item.description: The Kennedy Center is planning legal action after jazz musician Chuck Redd canceled an annual holiday concert. Redd pulled out after President Trump's...

item.title: Russia attacks Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-U.S. talks
item.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between ...

item.title: ADHD drugs may work indirectly to boost attention
item.description: Drugs like Adderall and Ritalin appear to help children with ADHD by activating brain areas involved in alertness and motivation.

item.title: Our top global photo stories from 2025: Fearless women, solo polar bear, healing soups
item.description: These stunning photos include a polar bear in a Chinese zoo, a teen in Zambia facing an uncertain future, Mongolian kids watching TV in a tent, a chef...

item.title: Opinion: The best gift we can give the departed is to keep their sparkle alive
item.description: Christmastime is full of joy, sure, but also full of bittersweetness from nostalgia and loss. NPR's Scott Simon details a holiday encounter in his kit...

item.title: Attack on Kyiv shows 'Russia doesn't want peace', Zelensky says
item.description: The 10-hour missile and drone barrage directed at Ukraine's capital killed two people and left 32 injured, local authorities say.

item.title: Russia targets Kyiv with deadly strikes ahead of Trump-Zelenskyy meeting
item.description: Explosions boomed across Kyiv for hours as ballistic missiles and drones hit the city in an attack that began early in the morning.

item.title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes
item.description: Almost one million people were displaced when hostilities resumed earlier this month after the first truce broke.

item.title: Sure, the newspaper informed. But as it fades, those who used it for other things must adjust, too
Georgia inmates threatened to kill Lyft driver during escape, affidavit reveals
item.description: The three inmates who escaped the DeKalb County Jail threatened to kill and sexually assault their terrified Lyft driver while fleeing to Florida, cou...

item.title: Michigan hires former Utah coach Kyle Whittingham to lead the Wolverines
item.description: The university fired ex-coach Sherrone Moore on Dec. 10 for having an "inappropriate relationship" with a female staffer.

item.title: New York blanketed in snow, sparking travel chaos
item.description: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled and more than 3,000 were delayed by the winter storm.

item.title: 12/27: Saturday Morning
item.description: Major storms across the U.S. are threatening holiday travel. Meanwhile, President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy are set to meet.

item.title: Nine arrested in Italy for allegedly raising millions for Hamas
item.description: Police say the suspects raised around €7m (£6m) for the militant group over more than two years.

item.title: Winter storm snarls U.S. holiday travel across Northeast, Great Lakes
item.description: More than a thousand flights were canceled or delayed across the Northeast and Great Lakes as a winter storm disrupted one of the busiest travel weeke...

item.title: Man charged with fatal shooting of woman during backyard target practice
item.description: The victim was sitting with her family under a covered porch several blocks away when she was hit by a bullet, according to a probable cause affidavit...

item.title: Anonymous money fuels $5 million in attacks on Georgia’s Lt. Gov. Burt Jones
US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
item.description: Trump tells Politico he ordered the strikes as "a Christmas present" - contradicting a statement by Nigerian officials.
